column4: my ubuntu 10.10 automatically launches nautilus on starting, if I want to browse "network" or the computer icon, al I get is: Nautilus cannot handle "computer" locations. how do I make my machine not to launch nautilus automatically?
What part of nautilus is causing a problem?

I think I couldnt tell: it all started when I updated Ubuntu 10.10 for the last time, a couple of days ago: now I cannot access to any of my external hard drives (Gparted recognizes them, I cannot display the contents or edit them. wanting to access this external drives I tried different icon,s , including the "brose all local and remote discs" (the purple computer), and thats where the messa ge appeared. BTW; i cann
Sounds like you need to double check fstab and make sure everything is mounting correctly..
Check the output of 'dmesg' or /var/log/syslog for error messages
I have accesses the huge syslog file, what do I have to look for?
Any interesting messages pertaining to your issue
you are aware that Im a total noob, right?
You mentioned something about running a server..
So you click on the computer icon in places menu and it gives an error message?
Probably some problem with upgrading instead of installing fresh
Do you know what prefix it installed to?
